answers.answer: Try walking, nipple stimulation, an exercise ball, sex, squats. Good luck =)!
I've been doing so much walking my legs feel like they are. about to fall off. The baby's low my cervix is thin, just not dilating. I really don't want another Csection if I can avoid it

Have they tried doing that examination down there? (Forgot the name of the examination) I remember it was only after that  i started dilating and my contractions intensifying. However my waters had broken already at home after having walked for hours. I also had a c section for my first and I didnt want a repeat xx

Have you had a membrane sweep? I hear that gets labor going normally in a day or 2. Unfortunately if nothing is happening by next wk, I would go for the Section as much as you don't want it. This way you won't miss any of your family events and won't have any trouble with delivery. I hear moat inductions end up in c section anyway

I'm also avoidant of c-sections. A doc told me that my son was breech and offered c-section in a way that sounded like he was expecting me to be like "yay, yes please" and I yelled at him to turn him even if it hurt me etc. If it were me and it stays safe I'd wait until Monday. I've heard that nipple stimulation has been proven to help but I've always been induced so I don't know from personal experience.

From what my Dr said, she can't do anything until I start to dilate Idk. I could wait and see if I labor on my own but then theres a chance he will be too big and still need a Csection.my last ultrasound was about 2weeks ago and he was around 6lb 5oz but the Dr thinks he may now be around 8lb. I've only gained about 1 1/2 lb since then so Idk if they will check again or just try to push for the Csection
When she checked my cervix she said she was hoping to get a finger in and at least try to get things started. Idk exactly what she meant, but I'm getting desperate.
When she checked my cervix she said she was hoping to get a finger in and at least try to get things started. Idk exactly what she meant, but I'm getting desperate.

I would also suggest ask your doctor to do a membrane sweep,you dont have to be dialated to that have that done.it worked well for me on 3 pregnancies,i was in labor a few hours later after it...worth a shot anyway..personally i would avoid a csection as its a much harder recovery...good luck

I was asked today if I wanted a c-section also, I have no problem with my pregnancy the only thing is im not dilated, so I understand where your coming from. did you ask your doctor what the risks are if you wait another week if you have diabetes? And Did your doctor check the baby's weight through an ultrasound or just an estimated guess?? because my doctor told me that even if she guesses its not always right. I understand that your trying to avoid a c-section because believe me I am going to the same thing!!! but my advise is maybe just wait and see if the baby wants to come out naturally, and even if he is bigger and you have to get a c-section just be thankful that his healthy! I decided to wait and I'm leaving everything in God's hands. so hopefully you can decide on whatever decision you think would be best for you and the baby:) good luck!
I say whatever is best for your baby and yourself go with that

What exactly is a membrane sweep? I've seen it a lot on here, just not familiar with it.and @gabby No I didn't ask what the risks were of waiting. I have my sugar levels under control with my diet and as far as I know he was only 6lb 5 oz when I was just about 37 weeks. they haven't done another ultrasound so she's just assuming he may be around  8lb now

Sounds like your doctor is trying to do what's more convenient for her! If the baby was only 6 pounds couple of weeks ago i don't think he's gained 2 pounds already! And if you feel fine and your sugar is under control than just go with ur instinct!

Yea I kinda got that same vibe. Where I go, There's actually 3 Dr's that deliberately and u meet with all of them during your pregnancy. She delivered my last baby and I really like her but it just seemed like the other Dr that I have been discussing the whole vbac plan with has been so much more supportive. I'm due April 4 and she basically said if I'm not dilated Monday (3/30) we should set up a Csection date and that we can do it either Tues or Wed of that week. I won't even be 40 weeks yet, so it just felt to me that she didn't think I could do it and just wanted to do it the quicker way. Idk

Well it's final, I'm still not dilated,  my cervix is still on the thick side, so my Dr doesn't recommend trying for a vbac. Csection has been scheduled for Thursday. She tried to force a finger into my cervix but she couldn't but maybe things will change between now and Thursday. I doubt it. Very disappointed about this but I'll get over it. At least I'll be home for Easter with my family!

question: Well I'll be 39 weeks tomorrow and  an still both dilated. My Dr gave me the option to have a Csection either Tuesday or Wednesday next week if I haven't dilated as of Monday. I wanted to attempt a vbac, but was told unless I dilate she can't start pitocin or break my water. i dont want to wait too long because I have gestational diabetes and he will just get bigger.Idk what I should do. I don't want to miss Easter with NYC kids and my youngest has his 1st bday on the 8th. What would u do if in this situation?
title: csection or wait?
